intro: Connarus monocarpos, commonly known as the single-seeded connarus, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a single seed per fruit, which is a distinguishing feature. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique reproductive structure and ecological adaptations.
